title: Understanding Quantum Numbers
text: Quantum numbers are used to describe the position and energy of an electron in an atom. There are four quantum numbers: $$n$$, l, ml, and ms.

title: Principal Quantum Number (n)
text: The principal quantum number, $$n$$, indicates the energy level of an electron. It can be any positive integer (1, $$2$$, $$3$$, ...).

title: Angular Momentum Quantum Number (l)
text: The angular momentum quantum number, l, indicates the shape of the orbital. It can be any integer from $$0$$ to $$n-1$$.

title: Magnetic Quantum Number (ml)
text: The magnetic quantum number, ml, indicates the orientation of the orbital in space. It can be any integer from -l to $$+l$$.

title: Spin Quantum Number (ms)
text: The spin quantum number, ms, indicates the spin of the electron. It can be either $$\frac{+1}{2}$$ or $$\frac{-1}{2}$$.

title: Determine the Principal Quantum Number (n)
text: For the fluorine atom, the last electron is added to the $$2p$$ orbital. What is the principal quantum number, $$n$$, for this orbital?

title: Determine the Angular Momentum Quantum Number (l)
text: For the $$2p$$ orbital, what is the angular momentum quantum number, l?

title: Determine the Magnetic Quantum Number (ml)
text: For the $$2p$$ orbital, what are the possible values for the magnetic quantum number, ml?

title: Determine the Spin Quantum Number (ms)
text: For the last electron added to the fluorine atom, what is the positive spin quantum number, ms?

title: Putting It All Together
text: Now that you have determined each quantum number, you can identify the correct set of quantum numbers for the last electron in fluorine.
